lexUnit.name: thief.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who steals another person's property.

sentence.text: Keep your chequebook and your cheque card separate : If you make it easy for a thief to plunder your account by keeping your chequebook and card together , you could be held responsible for the whole amount .
Elle Folk are great thieves of dough and other food , and are strange-looking indeed .
They go to England , where Eric Claptout , the legendary thief of the blue dilithium crystals , says that Johnson was a top geezer .
` They will be kept in sheds , though bicycle thieves do n't usually bother with them .
It 's a killer they 're after , not a burglar or a car thief . "
Dogs barked and snapped , and we heard the sneak thief running barefoot into a maze of alleyways , bomb sites and derelict hotels .
The woman thief arrived with an accomplice at the house at Camlough and told the elderly woman she was thirsty .
Was it possible the police version ( which Cobalt had heard and Maurin had repeated ) was correct and the killing was a random attack by a thief on a passer-by ?
` I would think no jewel thief worth her salt would send a man directly to the hiding spot -- no matter how high above the ground she was floating . "
Or we would wish a society like Iran with its shariah or Islamic law , which punishes thieves by cutting off their hands ?
A thief would find a ladder and tools very useful to break into your house .
Cancel milk , papers and any other delivery which would let a thief know that your house is empty .
Mrs. Fielding , who suffers from extreme nervousness , was staying with one of her sons over the new year when thieves broke into her home in Milton Keynes and ransacked it .
Thieves have stolen seating worth Â£500 from a caravan at the Burtree Caravan Centre in Burtree Lane , Darlington .
Thieves have struck at the home of Oxfordshire 's High Sherrif , stealing priceless heirlooms and vandalising property .
The only way to catch an electronic thief , he said , is to set him up with erroneous information .
